Benefits of Dental Implants

The true effects of dental implants

Replace loose fitting dentures

Get rid of ill-fitting dentures through the adoption of dental implants. By securely affixing titanium posts to the jawbone, dental implants eliminate the inconvenience of denture instability. This solution not only ensures a comfortable fit but also restores confidence, allowing you to continue with daily activities without concerns of denture slippage.

Improve chewing and speaking

Dental implants provide a stable foundation as they are attached to your jawbone, making it easier for you to enjoy your favorite foods and communicate clearly. You won’t have to worry about your speech impediment and difficulty to chew.

Close large gaps

Your solution to a happy and complete smile. Dental implants effortlessly bridge the large gaps in your teeth and prevent your surrounding teeth from shifting. Dental implants are attached to your jawbone with a titanium bolt which acts as your natural tooth root.

Restore your former natural smile

Never been able to smile? Or miss your old Smile? Dental implants naturally blend with your existing teeth both functionally and aesthetically. Dental implants eliminate the gaps and discomfort you may be feeling but will also return your confidence and complete smile back to normal.

Meet your Dental Implant team

Our team is a carefully selected group of experienced professions, each dedicated to providing you with the best possible care.

Dr Nadim Majid

Dental surgeon / CEO Lifestyle Dental

BDS Liverpool 2001 MFGDP (RCS) UK NLP Practitioner Dip imp (RCSed) Msc UCLAN GDC No. 79353

Nadim is a dedicated and enthusiastic dental surgeon with a proven track record in delivering the highest standards of care, and holds a Masters Degree in implantology with Uclan.

Jenna

Your go-to for scheduling and answering any questions related to your Smile in a day treatment.

Ramin

As a Certified Dental Technician, Ramin expertly fits your customised bridge on the day of the surgery, ensuring comfort and a natural look.

Naomi

As our implant nurse, Naomis expertise adds an extra layer of care during your surgery, ensuring smooth comfortable experience.

Beatrix

Assisting during your surgery, Beatrixs attention to detail and calming presence provide an added layer of reassurance.

Frequently asked questions

Some common questions we get asked about dental implants

How much do dental implants cost?

Single tooth implants start from 2,500 per tooth.

What is the consultation process?

We find that a lot of patients are unsure about what dental implant treatment actually involves. This is why we encourage patients to book a free initial consultation with our Treatment Co-ordinator, Jenna.

During this consultation, suitable treatments options and finance options will be explained to you in detail. It will also give you the opportunity to ask any questions you may have about the process.

If you decide to continue with treatment, new patients will be asked to attend an initial assessment with Dr Nadim Majid. In this appointment, your overall dental health will be assessed before you move on to any further treatment.

Association of Dental Implantology

The Association of Dental Implantology (ADI) aims to provide the public with an improved understanding of the benefits of implantology, and members with the benefits of continuous skills development, safeguarding standards.

What dental implants do we offer?

We offer missing teeth solutions ranging from a single tooth to full-mouth restorations. Lifestyle Dental only use the highest quality implants to deliver excellent, natural-looking results to our patients. We use Tri Implants and Megagen as they offer very reliable dental implants that can last a lifetime.

"I have really bad teeth what are my options UK"

For those facing significant dental issues in the UK, there are various solutions available to enhance oral health.

Dental implants stand out as a durable and aesthetically pleasing option, providing a permanent remedy for missing or damaged teeth. Comprising titanium posts that fuse with the jawbone, dental implants offer stability for artificial teeth like crowns or bridges, restoring both functionality and confidence. Alternatively, individuals may explore options such as invisible braces for teeth straightening or porcelain veneers for cosmetic enhancement.

Consulting a member of our team is crucial to determine the most suitable solution based on individual needs, ensuring a personalised and effective treatment plan.
